article.headline: W. Carolina 66, Campbell 59
article.story: CULLOWHEE, N.C. -- Brigham Waginger scored all 12 of his points on 3s, including a rally-ending shot late in the game to help Western Carolina defeat Campbell 66-59 on Thursday night. The Catamounts (9-1), who won their eight straight, led 51-34 with 12:38 left before the Camels (5-2) scored 10 unanswered points during a 22-8 run. Amir Celestin, who scored eight points during the run, pulled Campbell within 59-56 on a jump shot with 2:25 left. Waginger then hit a 3-pointer and Mike Williams followed with a layup with 1:27 remaining to help the Catamounts pull ahead 64-56. Williams finished with 16 points and Richie Gordon tallied five blocks for the Catamounts. Western Carolina's Jake Robinson, who finished with eight points, scored his 1,000th on a 3 with 3:34 to play. Jonathan Rodriguez scored 18 points and grabbed 10 rebounds and Celestin added 12 points for the Camels.

statistics.description: The number of points scored.

statistics.name: assists
statistics.description: The number of times a player who passes the ball to a teammate in a way that leads to a score by field goal, meaning that he or she was "assisting" in the basket. There is some judgment involved in deciding whether a passer should be credited with an assist.

statistics.name: turnovers
statistics.description: The number of times a player loses possession to the other team.
